reviews.text: Pleasant station, not enough covered space, you can buy coffee outside during weekdays.

Horrible little station with the lacking facilities and a distinctive lack of step free access. The station is only accessible via a narrow and low subway. If you're over 6ft, do take care to mind your head.

Both platforms have shelter though the seating on the main platform, inside the shelter, had very wonky armrests. Station has a ticket office and is served by both Thameslink and Southern services
Lady at the ticket office is extremely rude and started complaining about doing any work to amend my ticket! Unbelievable.

Ticket machines often faulty. Lady who works in the ticket window most weekday mornings is extremely rude and dismissive of customers although to her credit, she knows her stuff. There’s loads of rubbish around the tracks which makes the station look grubby. The stairs on the Hove side have a few rotten stairs... an accident waiting to happen!

I’ve been to Preston Park many times and I really liked seeing more than 10 trains or so after a few seconds or mins and I would recommend for you to do some train spotting if you’ve never been to Preston Park station before.
